title: Large-Scale Instructional Design Strategies to Improve Learner Satisfaction in Blended and Online Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science education and experience with digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Capacity-building program for pre-service teachers in developing and operating science curriculum-integrated microlearning modules

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three factors influencing satisfaction in blended/online environments: instructional material quality, assessment strategies, and workload management.
Learners can propose content organization plans linked to long-term learner goals (certification acquisition, professional development) when designing modules.
Learners can design and apply at least two interaction strategies optimized for mobile-based microlearning.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
